perturbation.original_text: Wireless Products and Wireless Platform: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, exclusive (except as otherwise may be provided in this Agreement), non-transferable (except as permitted in Paragraph 17(d)) right and license to use, make, have made (as set forth in Paragraph 1(a)(i) below), reproduce, modify, and create derivative works of the PSM in each Property, solely for the purpose of developing the wireless applications specifically set forth for each of the Properties on Exhibits B through M attached hereto ("Wireless Products"), some of which Wireless Products are defined in the Glossary attached hereto as Exhibit N.
perturbation.changed_text: Wireless Products and Wireless Platform: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, exclusive (except as otherwise may be provided in this Agreement), non-transferable (except as permitted in Paragraph 17(d)) right and license to use, make, have made (as set forth in Paragraph 1(a)(i) below), reproduce, modify, and create derivative works of the PSM in each Property, solely for the purpose of developing the wireless applications specifically set forth for each of the Properties on Exhibits B through M attached hereto ("Wireless Products"), all of which Wireless Products are defined in Exhibits B through M. For sake of clarity, wireless products are uniquely defined within each exhibits, and supersede any other definition in the contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Wireless Products' by referring to Exhibits B through M and Exhibit N (Glossary). The modified text now states that Wireless Products are defined solely in Exhibits B through M, overriding any definition in the Glossary, and implying that definitions are unique in each exhibit. This creates contradiction with Exhibit N, where some wireless products are defined, creating ambiguity regarding the true definition.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall be responsible for all marketing, advertising and promotional efforts with respect to the Wireless Products throughout the Territory during the Term. Licensee shall (A) participate in face to face meetings and conference calls regarding marketing from time to time, the frequency, location and subject matter of which shall be mutually agreed; (B) submit a separate marketing plan for the Wireless Products for each Property for which Fox has approved a Treatment (as defined in Paragraph 9(a)(ii)) within thirty (30) days of Fox's approval of such Treatment, subject to Fox's providing sufficient information regarding its release plans for the applicable Property (each, a "Marketing Plan"); (C) commit funds to the marketing of the Wireless Products as is commensurate with Licensee's marketing efforts of other similar wireless products that Licensee publishes; (D) perform business to business and trade marketing efforts (e.g., to the CSPs) commensurate with industry standards; and (E) appoint a marketing point of contact which shall be responsible for coordinating communications and facilitating relationships between Fox and Licensee and for overseeing the performance of Licensee's obligations hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall be responsible for all marketing, advertising and promotional efforts with respect to the Wireless Products throughout the Territory during the Term. Licensee shall (A) participate in face to face meetings and conference calls regarding marketing from time to time, the frequency, location and subject matter of which shall be determined solely by Licensee; (B) submit a marketing plan for the Wireless Products generally, which is optional and at the discretion of Licensee; (C) commit funds to the marketing of the Wireless Products at a level determined by Licensee based on its own internal budget allocations; (D) perform business to business and trade marketing efforts (e.g., to the CSPs) as Licensee deems appropriate; and (E) designate a point of contact, which may be reassigned or eliminated at Licensee's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text outlines specific requirements for Licensee's marketing efforts, implying obligations to Fox. The modified text gives Licensee complete discretion over the marketing efforts. This creates a conflict with the original intent by making those efforts optional and internally driven rather than collaboratively defined, creating ambiguity in obligations. If Fox expected certain marketing efforts, this contradiction prevents enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Paragraph 15(b), in the event of termination of this Agreement, Licensee shall have a period of ***** from the date of such termination (unless such termination occurs less than ***** prior to the expiration of this Agreement in which case the time period shall be shortened accordingly so as not to exceed the date of expiration) in which to sell-off existing inventory of Wireless Products already in the Distribution Channels ("Sell Off Period"). Licensee agrees that no additional Wireless Products may be developed or distributed during the Sell Off Period and Licensee agrees to require that any Licensed CSP to comply with this provision. Upon the expiration of the Sell Off Period, Licensee agrees to destroy all such remaining inventory and confirm same in writing to Fox (and require that any Licensed CSP do the same). Any revenues, credits or other consideration received by Licensee for the Wireless Products during the Sell Off Period will be subject to Licensee's obligation to pay Fox Royalties pursuant to Paragraph 7 above.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Paragraph 15(b), in the event of termination of this Agreement, Licensee shall have a period of ***** from the date of such termination (unless such termination occurs less than ***** prior to the expiration of this Agreement in which case the time period shall be shortened accordingly so as not to exceed the date of expiration) in which to sell-off existing inventory of Wireless Products already in the Distribution Channels ("Sell Off Period"). Licensee agrees that additional Wireless Products may be developed and distributed during the Sell Off Period at a discounted rate, and Licensee will encourage Licensed CSPs to offer promotions to clear inventory. Upon the expiration of the Sell Off Period, Licensee agrees to provide a report to Fox on remaining inventory and discuss potential options, including but not limited to destruction or donation. Any revenues, credits or other consideration received by Licensee for the Wireless Products during the Sell Off Period will be subject to Licensee's obligation to pay Fox Royalties pursuant to Paragraph 7 above, unless mutually agreed upon otherwise for promotional purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits development or distribution of new products and mandates destruction of remaining inventory. The modified text now permits further development and distribution and makes inventory disposal negotiable. This contradicts the original's strict sell-off period rules, creating uncertainty about permissible activities post-termination and leading to conflicting interpretations during potential disputes.
